intro: Scrophularia ballsii, commonly known as the purple marsh orchid, is a flowering plant native to wetland habitats in Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae, which includes many species with showy flowers. The plant produces tall, slender stems with clusters of violet or purple flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and arranged oppositely along the stem. Scrophularia ballsii is often found in moist, sunny environments such as meadows and riverbanks.
